name: Khalil Center
mission: Our wellness centers integrate Islamic spiritual approaches into professional psychology to help achieve optimal, holistic health by providing a wide variety of mental health services.
theoryOfChange: Khalil Center utilizes an "integrative treatment framework" or "Traditional Islamically Integrated Psychotherapy (TIIP) model" to guide its approach to mental healthcare. This framework outlines Islamic beliefs regarding health, pathology, human ontology, and epistemology, and integrates modern psychological science to address psychological, spiritual, and communal health. The TIIP model emphasizes psychological reconstruction, behavioral reformation, and spiritual elevation. It serves as a structured approach for integrating contemporary behavioral science into an inherently Islamic framework, rooted in an Islamic epistemological and ontological framework.

evaluationSources: Practice-based evidence study published in Spirituality in Clinical Practice
Research published in Journal of Muslim Mental Health

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://khalilcenter.com/donate/zakat (Source: https://khalilcenter.com/donate/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The Khalil Foundation reported total revenue of $2,272,898 and a program expense ratio of 71.2%.
The Khalil Foundation is zakat-eligible and follows specific policies for asnaf categories.
Financial data from 2023 confirms the organization's revenue and expense allocations.
The organization tracks metrics such as clinical appointments scheduled and professional training scholarships distributed.
The center delivers psychotherapy sessions and didactic trainings as part of its core clinical programs.
The organization provides multiple giving methods and donation options for supporters.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a 66/100 score due to its high alignment with niche donor needs and exceptional fundraising efficiency, though its overall impact score is moderated by a high cost per beneficiary.
areas_for_improvement: Limited working capital of 2.4 months suggests a need for larger cash reserves
Low data confidence score indicates a need for more robust third-party verification

dimension_explanations.alignment: The foundation shows high alignment for donors prioritizing global health and Islamic-integrated care, as it is explicitly zakat-eligible [2]. Its track record includes delivering didactic trainings and clinical appointments tailored to the community's spiritual and psychological needs [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization reported a total revenue of $2,272,898 and maintains a program expense ratio of 71.2% [1][3]. While it successfully delivers psychotherapy sessions and professional training scholarships, the cost per beneficiary is approximately $907.87, and the organization holds 2.4 months of working capital [4][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Khalil Foundation integrates faith-based principles with psychological sciences to provide comprehensive mental health services and community education.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.01 per $1 raised
Strong alignment for Muslim donors seeking faith-integrated clinical services
Transparent zakat policy and eligibility for asnaf categories
baseline_narrative.summary: The Khalil Foundation, operating as the Khalil Center, provides clinical mental health services and didactic training rooted in Islamic traditions [1][5]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through contributions to mental health equity [2][6].

alignment.explanation: Alignment is high due to <cite id="2">verified zakat eligibility</cite> for the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin), and a mission that directly serves <cite id="1">underserved Muslim populations</cite> in the global health space.
alignment.improvement: Expand services to <cite id="1">underserved geographies</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage to further increase the 'Underserved Space' score.

credibility.explanation: The Khalil Center demonstrates credibility through <cite id="3">consistent IRS reporting</cite> and a <cite id="1">100% independent board</cite>. However, <cite id="1">low data confidence</cite> stems from a lack of comprehensive third-party ratings and limited public transparency seals.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should pursue a Candid Seal of Transparency and increase the public availability of its audited financial statements.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="3">71.2% program ratio</cite> and a high volume of <cite id="5">70,136 psychotherapy sessions</cite>. The cost per beneficiary is approximately <cite id="1">$907.87</cite>, which is consistent with specialized clinical health services.
impact.improvement: Build reserves toward a target range of 3-12 months to ensure <cite id="1">financial health</cite> and resilience against revenue volatility.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize faith-integrated mental healthcare and want to support a high-efficiency clinical model that serves the Muslim community's specific psychological needs.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat through mental health equity
Value the integration of Islamic theology with clinical science
Prefer organizations with extremely low fundraising overhead
Support professionalizing Islamic psychology as a field
giving_considerations: The organization is in a lean financial position with low reserves
Revenue has remained flat over the last three years
Focus is on specialized clinical care rather than broad humanitarian aid
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high-growth organizations with large cash reserves or those looking for general medical relief rather than specialized mental health.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade B reflects verified output tracking (sessions, trainings) and a documented clinical framework, though independent longitudinal studies are not publicly cited.
external_evaluations: International Association of Islamic Psychology standards
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The Khalil Center utilizes a 'Traditional Islamically Integrated Psychotherapy' (TIIP) framework to improve mental health outcomes by aligning clinical interventions with the patient's spiritual worldview.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: In mental health, evidence ensures that faith-based interventions meet clinical safety and efficacy standards.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With flat revenue growth and low reserves, the organization has significant capacity to absorb new funding to expand its clinical waitlists.
strategic_priorities: Expand clinical services in NYC and LA
Grow the School of Islamic Psychology

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: USA, Canada, UK, Pakistan, Turkey, Qatar

strengths.detail: The organization spends only <cite id="1">$0.01 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions, ensuring nearly all donor funds are available for core operations.
The center successfully delivered <cite id="5">over 70,000 psychotherapy sessions</cite> and scheduled <cite id="4">13,065 clinical appointments</cite> in recent reporting periods.
They pioneered the <cite id="1">School of Islamic Psychology & Research</cite> and established the <cite id="1">International Association of Islamic Psychology</cite> to standardize faith-based care.

strengths_deep_dive: The Khalil Center's impact is rooted in its ability to scale specialized services across diverse geographies. By providing <cite id="5">70,136 psychotherapy sessions</cite>, they address mental health stigma within the Muslim community through a culturally competent lens. Their educational arm further extends this impact, having distributed <cite id="4">50 professional training scholarships</cite> and conducting <cite id="5">324 didactic trainings</cite> to build global capacity in Islamically integrated care. This dual approach of direct service and systemic capacity building is supported by a <cite id="3">71.2% program expense ratio</cite>, demonstrating that the vast majority of their <cite id="3">$2.27 million revenue</cite> is utilized for mission-critical activities.
rich_narrative.summary: The Khalil Foundation, operating as the Khalil Center, is a specialized mental health organization that <cite id="1">integrates faith-based principles with psychological sciences</cite> to serve the Muslim community. Since its <cite id="1">founding in 2010</cite>, the center has expanded its footprint to include clinical locations in <cite id="1">New York City, Los Angeles, and Chicago</cite>, as well as international operations in <cite id="1">Pakistan and Turkey</cite>. The organization addresses a critical gap in global health by providing <cite id="5">Islamically integrated psychotherapy</cite>, a model that combines traditional Islamic theology with modern clinical practices. Financially, the organization reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $2,272,898</cite> in 2023, with a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 71.2%</cite>. Their operational efficiency is notable, maintaining a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. Beyond direct clinical care, the center operates a <cite id="1">School of Islamic Psychology & Research</cite> to train the next generation of practitioners. Impact data indicates significant scale, with the organization delivering <cite id="5">70,136 total psychotherapy sessions</cite> and <cite id="5">324 didactic trainings</cite> as reported in their most recent impact cycle. As a <cite id="2">zakat-eligible institution</cite>, the Khalil Center provides a unique avenue for Muslim donors to direct their obligatory charity toward <cite id="2">mental health equity for the poor and needy</cite>.
